### isLegalToPromote() {#a761788c72f76b021745979565633abf4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool TypePromotionImpl::isLegalToPromote (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V)</>}>
Check that the type of V would be promoted and that the original type is smaller than the targeted promoted type.

Check that we&#39;re not trying to promote something larger than our base &#39;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize">TypeSize</a>&#39; type.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/typepromotion-cpp/#l00172">172</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/typepromotion-cpp">TypePromotion.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/typepromotion-cpp/#l00164">164</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/typepromotion-cpp">TypePromotion.cpp</a>.

### isSink() {#a5bcd99ae0f1c68725e8bbb699f37cafe}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool TypePromotionImpl::isSink (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V)</>}>
Return true if V will require any promoted values to be truncated for the the IR to remain valid.

We can&#39;t mutate the value type of these instructions.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/typepromotion-cpp/#l00158">158</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/typepromotion-cpp">TypePromotion.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isSource() {#ab4da758860dc01584408b71ea81a39bb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool TypePromotionImpl::isSource (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V)</>}>
Return true if the given value is a source in the use-def chain, producing a narrow &#39;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize">TypeSize</a>&#39; value.

These values will be zext to start the promotion of the tree to i32. We guarantee that these won&#39;t populate the upper bits of the register. ZExt on the loads will be free, and the same for call return values because we only accept ones that guarantee a zeroext ret val. Many arguments will have the zeroext attribute too, so those would be free too.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/typepromotion-cpp/#l00156">156</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/typepromotion-cpp">TypePromotion.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isSupportedType() {#af46e1eedf077b96d43fbacef7c23246d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool TypePromotionImpl::isSupportedType (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V)</>}>
We disallow booleans to make life easier when dealing with icmps but allow any other integer that fits in a scalar register.

Void types are accepted so we can handle switches.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/typepromotion-cpp/#l00166">166</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/typepromotion-cpp">TypePromotion.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isSupportedValue() {#a30bdfe4e7169d81d5f3ba244cb2ebd6c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool TypePromotionImpl::isSupportedValue (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V)</>}>
We accept most instructions, as well as Arguments and ConstantInsts.

We Disallow casts other than zext and truncs and only allow calls if their return value is zeroext. We don&#39;t allow opcodes that can introduce sign bits.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/typepromotion-cpp/#l00169">169</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/typepromotion-cpp">TypePromotion.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
